thread.title: Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett bringing team to Ground Zero before game vs. Giants
thread.title_full: Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett bringing team to Ground Zero before game vs. Giants

author: James Kratch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett bringing team to Ground Zero before game vs. Giants
text:
Comments 
EAST RUTHERFORD — This past summer, Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett and his wife, Brill, visited the One World Trade Center Observatory in New York. 
And within 10 minutes, Garrett said he told her he needed to find a way to bring his team to Ground Zero for an experience he says is "life-changing in so many different ways." 
Garrett will do just that this Friday, as the Cowboys will leave Dallas a day earlier than usual as they come east to take on the Giants at MetLife Stadium on Sunday . 
"We're going to have a team dinner (Friday) over at the One World Trade Center Observatory at the Freedom Tower," Garrett told New York-area reporters during a conference call. "I just thought it was fantastic, for so many different reasons." 
WATCH : Daniel Fells reunites with family following 3 weeks in hospital with MRSA 
Garrett said the Cowboys were able to adjust their schedule for the trip thanks to the extra time provided by being idle this past week on a bye. The team will continue with its usual pregame preparations Saturday at both the team hotel, and a nearby high school field. 
Garrett, a Princeton grad, was playing for the Giants on 9/11. 
"It was a significant tragedy in our country's history, and I feel like they captured it so well," Garrett said. "The tragedy of it, and then also the inspirational response that everyone in New York, and in the surrounding areas and in our country to this tragedy. Being there this summer, I think you feel both those things. You feel the tragedy, but you also feel the response and the resiliency of our country, as manifested by that Freedom Tower." TALK IS CHEAP, Ep. 28: Sloppy Giants got what they deserved vs. Eagles 
We knew it was going to be a tough spot for the Giants, but after the ugly 27-7 loss in Philadelphia, some may be wondering: Is this déjà vu all over again? Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes or Stitcher .
